Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Zepar-san, Furfur-san...! Why...why this duel?! This is no trial of love! You really are demons! You just want to enjoy watching one of the pairs fall apart, don't you...?!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Zepar‐san, Furfur‐san...! Why......why this duel?! This is no trial of love! You really are demons! You just want to enjoy watching one of the pairs fall apart...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Zepar-san, Furfur-san...! Why......why this duel?! This is no trial of love! You really are demons! You just want to enjoy watching one of the pairs fall apart, don't you...?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ゼパルさん、フルフルさん…！　どうしてこんな、……こんな決闘を？！　こんなの恋の試練じゃない！　やっぱりあなたたちは悪魔なんです！　どちらかの恋人たちを破綻させて、それを見て喜びたいだけの悪魔なんです…！！」
Russian (RU): "Зепар, Фурфур!.. Зачем...... зачем нужна эта дуэль?! Это не испытание любви! Вы и вправду демоны! Вы просто получаете удовольствие от наблюдения за тем, как распадается одна из пар!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Zepar‐san, Furfur‐san...! Por que......por que este duelo?! Isto não é uma prova de amor! Você são mesmo demônios! Só querem se divertir assistindo um casal se separar...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「賽帕爾大人，芙爾芙爾大人…！為什麼要、……為什麼要進行這種決鬥？！這種決鬥不是戀愛的考驗！你們果然是惡魔！你們只是想看到其中一對戀人被拆散，然後為之歡欣鼓舞的惡魔…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「赛帕尔大人，芙尔芙尔大人…！为什么要、……为什么要进行这种决斗？！这种决斗不是恋爱的考验！你们果然是恶魔！你们只是想看到其中一对恋人被拆散，然后为之欢欣鼓舞的恶魔…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Zepar-san, Furfur-san...! Perché... perché questo duello?! Questa non è una prova d'amore! Siete davvero dei demoni! Volete solo divertirvi nel guardare una delle due coppie crollare, non è così...?!!"

Russian (RU): Они посмотрели на ослепляющее небо......... и доверили всё богине судьбы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O par olhou para o brilhante céu............e confiou tudo à Deusa da Sorte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 兩人仰望著耀眼的天空，…………將一切都托付給了幸運女神。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 两人仰望着耀眼的天空，…………将一切都托付给了幸运女神。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La coppia ammirò il cielo brillante... e affidò tutto alla dea della fortuna.

Steam (ST): ...Then, they each grabbed one of the guns out of the air, and after dancing a momentary rondo, ......their arms crossed each other.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, they each grabbed one of the guns out of the air, and after dancing a momentary rondo, ............their arms crossed each other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, they each grabbed one of the guns out of the air, and after dancing a momentary rondo, .........their arms crossed each other.
PC Japanese (JP): そして二人は同時にそれぞれ一丁ずつ、銃を天に掴み、そして二人でたった一度だけロンドを踊って、…………互いの腕が交差する。
Russian (RU): Затем каждый из них схватил из воздуха по одному пистолету, и после мгновенного рондо............ их руки скрестились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, cada um agarrou uma das armas que estava no ar, e após dançarem um momentâneo rondó, ............seus braços se cruzaram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後兩人同時在空中各抓到了一把槍，然後兩人身體再次旋轉，…………手臂互相交叉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后两人同时在空中各抓到了一把枪，然后两人身体再次旋转，…………手臂互相交叉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In seguito, entrambi presero al volo una delle pistole, e dopo aver ballato un rondò momentaneo... le loro braccia si incrociarono.

Steam (ST): Even that had been like a dance.
Umineko Project (UP): Even that was like a dance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even that had been like a dance.
PC Japanese (JP): それすらもまるでダンス。
Russian (RU): Даже это было как танец.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até mesmo isso foi como uma dança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就仿彿起舞一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就仿佛起舞一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Persino quel movimento era parso simile ad una danza.

Steam (ST): Then, they each pressed the barrel of their gun up against the other's forehead, both as steady as a rock.
Umineko Project (UP): And the barrels of each of their guns came to a dead stop against each other's forehead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, they each pressed the barrel of their gun up against the other's forehead, both as steady as a rock.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、互いの銃口をびったりと、互いの額に押し付けあって、石のように静止した。
Russian (RU): Они оба прижали ствол пистолета ко лбу другого с каменной твёрдостью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O cano de cada uma das armas parou contra a testa de cada um, ambas de prontidão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨後，兩人的槍口恰好抵在對方的額頭上，岩石一般瞬間靜止了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随后，两人的枪口恰好抵在对方的额头上，岩石一般瞬间静止了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In seguito, entrambi premettero la canna della propria pistola contro la fronte dell'altro, fermi come delle rocce.

Umineko Project (UP): Even they could not know......which gun held the bullet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): どちらの銃に弾が入っているか、……お互いも知りえない。
Russian (RU): Даже они не знали...... в каком пистолете пуля.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 兩人都不可能知道，……誰的槍裡面有子彈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 两人都不可能知道，……谁的枪里面有子弹。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Persino ora, non potevano sapere... quale pistola conteneva il proiettile.

Steam (ST): When they both pressed the triggers, ...one would die, and one would remain alive.
Umineko Project (UP): When they both pulled the triggers, ......one would die, and one would remain alive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When they both pressed the triggers, ......one would die, and one would remain alive.
PC Japanese (JP): 互いが引き金を引けば、……どちらかが死に、どちらかが生き残る。
Russian (RU): Когда они оба нажмут на курок...... один умрёт, а другой останется в живых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ambos puxassem os gatilhos, ......um morreria e o outro permaneceria vivo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一起開槍的話……一人死，一人生。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一起开枪的话……一人死，一人生。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se entrambi avessero premuto il grilletto... uno sarebbe morto, e l'altro sarebbe rimasto in vita.

Steam (ST): The match would end.
Umineko Project (UP): The match would end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The match would end.
PC Japanese (JP): 決着がつく。
Russian (RU): Поединок закончится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A partida acabaria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 勝負分曉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 胜负分晓。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il combattimento si sarebbe concluso.

Steam (ST): George and Jessica wouldn't know the result until that moment came.
Umineko Project (UP): George and Jessica had no way of knowing how it would turn out until that moment came.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George and Jessica wouldn't know how it had turned out until that moment came.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治と朱志香は、その瞬間を迎えるまで、勝敗を知りえない。
Russian (RU): Джордж и Джессика не узнают, как всё обстоит, пока не увидят результат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até que o último momento chegasse, George e Jessica não tinham como prever o desdobrando final.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治和朱志香，在那一瞬間到來之前，也不可能知道孰勝孰敗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治和朱志香，在那一瞬间到来之前，也不可能知道孰胜孰败。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Finché quel momento non fosse venuto, George e Jessica non avrebbero saputo come sarebbe andata a finire.

Steam (ST): ...However, was it really impossible for the two holding the guns to know...?
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, was it really impossible for the two holding the guns to know...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, was it really impossible for the two holding the guns to know...?
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、銃口を額に押し付け合う二人には、本当にその瞬間まで知りえないだろうか…？
Russian (RU): ......Но разве у тех, кто держит пистолеты, нет возможности узнать?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas era realmente impossível, para aqueles segurando as armas, diferenciá‐las...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，互相以槍口抵住對方額頭的兩個人，真的直到那一瞬間之前都不知道結果嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，互相以枪口抵住对方额头的两个人，真的直到那一瞬间之前都不知道结果吗…？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia, era davvero impossibile che i due che possedevano le armi potessero sapere...?

Steam (ST): The muzzle of Kanon's gun, which had already been fired, must have been warm. And the muzzle of the other gun, which Shannon hadn't fired, should have been ice-cold.
Umineko Project (UP): The barrel of Kanon's gun, which had already been fired, must have been warm.{n}And the barrel of the other gun, which Shannon hadn't fired, should have been ice‐cold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The barrel of Kanon's gun, which had already been fired, must have been warm. And the barrel of the other gun, which Shannon hadn't fired, should have been ice-cold.
PC Japanese (JP): 先に撃った嘉音の銃口は、きっと熱を持っている。一方、まだ撃っていない紗音の銃口は冷え切っているはずだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 先に撃った嘉音の銃口は、きっと熱を持っている。{n}一方、まだ撃っていない紗音の銃口は冷え切っているはずだ。
Russian (RU): Ствол пистолета Канона, из которого уже стреляли, должен быть тёплым.{n}А ствол другого, из которого Шаннон не стреляла, наверняка ледяной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O cano da arma de Kanon, que havia acabado de disparar, ainda deveria estar quente.{n}E o cano da outra arma, na qual Shannon não havia disparado, ainda deveria estar frio como gelo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音的槍剛才開過，肯定感覺得到溫度。{n}而還沒有開過槍的紗音的槍口，理應是冰冷的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音的枪刚才开过，肯定感觉得到温度。{n}而还没有开过枪的纱音的枪口，理应是冰冷的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La canna della pistola di Kanon, con la quale aveva già sparato, doveva essere stata calda. E la canna dell'altra pistola, con la quale Shannon non aveva ancora fatto fuoco, dovrebbe essere stata gelida.

Steam (ST): So, perhaps the pair of them... did realize which gun was which.
Umineko Project (UP): So, perhaps the pair of them......did realize which gun was which.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, perhaps the pair of them......did realize which gun was which.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、相手の銃口を額に突き付けている二人には、……お互いの銃がどちらのものか、わかっているのではないだろうか。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, возможно, они оба...... поняли, у кого чей пистолет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, é possível que o par......tivesse percebido qual era qual.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，額頭上各自抵著對方槍口的兩個人，……說不定已經知道了，彼此的槍究竟是誰的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，额头上各自抵着对方枪口的两个人，……说不定已经知道了，彼此的枪究竟是谁的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, è probabile che la coppia... si fosse resa conto di chi fosse la propria pistola.

Steam (ST): ...And yet, ......both expressions were solemn, ......the faces of those who would believe in their fate unswervingly until the moment the triggers were pulled.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And yet, .........both expressions were as solemn as could be, ............showing that they would hold total belief and zero doubt in their own fates until the moment the trigger was pulled.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And yet, .........both expressions were solemn, ......filled with absolutely no doubts in their own fate until the moment the trigger would be pulled.
PC Japanese (JP): ……にもかかわらず、………二人の表情は真剣そのもので、…………引き金を引くその瞬間まで、……自分の運命を信じて、まったく疑わないものだった。
Russian (RU): ......И всё равно......... они выглядели торжественно...... и нисколько не сомневались в своей судьбе до самого нажатия на курок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E, mesmo assim, .........ambos as expressões eram solenes, ............demonstrando que eles tinham total confiança e nenhuma dúvida sobre seus destinos até o momento em que fossem puxados os gatilhos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……儘管如此，………兩人的表情還是只能以認真來形容，…………直到扣動扳機的那一瞬間，……都對自己的命運深信不疑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……尽管如此，………两人的表情还是只能以认真来形容，…………直到扣动扳机的那一瞬间，……都对自己的命运深信不疑。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Malgrado ciò... le espressioni di entrambi erano solenni... completamente vuote di incertezze per il proprio fato fino al momento in cui il grilletto sarebbe stato premuto.

Speaker: Shannon

Umineko Project (UP): "And that way, ......we wouldn't have to see each other again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That way, ......we would never have to be reunited."

Speaker: Kanon
Steam (ST): "It's all right. Considering what day this is, even this duel is just a farce."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's alright. Considering what day this is, even this duel is just a farce."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいさ。この決闘さえも、もはや今日という日の前には、ただの茶番さ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいさ。この決闘さえも、もはや今日という日の前には、ただの茶番さ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Considerando o que é o dia de hoje, até mesmo este duelo não passa de uma farsa."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒關係啊。就連這場決鬥，相比於今天這個日子而言，也不過是一場鬧劇。」

Umineko Project (UP): "You're right... If we're just going to revive in the Golden Land anyway, it really is just a farce."

Steam (ST): Suddenly, ...Kanon fell to the floor as if he'd had an attack of anemia.
Umineko Project (UP): Suddenly, .........Kanon fell to the floor as if he'd had an attack of anemia.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Suddenly, ......Kanon fell to the floor as if he'd had an attack of anemia.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音が突然、……貧血でも起こしたかのように、………くしゃりと、床に崩れ落ちたのだ。
Russian (RU): Неожиданно...... будто в приступе анемии... Канон упал на пол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De repente, .........Kanon caiu no chão, como se tivesse tido um ataque de anemia.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音似乎，……突然出现了贫血症状，………颓然倒地。

Steam (ST): It had happened without any warning beforehand, so everyone rushed up to him in alarm.
Umineko Project (UP): It happened without any prior warning, so everyone rushed up to him in alarm.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had happened without any warning beforehand, so everyone rushed up to him in alarm.
PC Japanese (JP): 何の予兆もなく突然だったので、驚き、みんなが駆け寄る。
Russian (RU): Он упал ни с того ни с сего, и все в тревоге бросились к нему.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aconteceu sem aviso prévio, por isso todos correram preocupados até ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這一切由於毫無任何預兆，大家都大吃一驚紛紛跑過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这一切由于毫无任何预兆，大家都大吃一惊纷纷跑过去。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era successo senza alcun preavviso, perciò tutti andarono di corsa verso di lui, allarmati.

Steam (ST): What they saw surprised them. There was a single strand of blood across his forehead, making it look as though it had cracked open...
Umineko Project (UP): What they saw surprised them. There was a single strand of blood across his forehead, making it look as though it had cracked open...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What they saw surprised them. There was a single strand of blood across his forehead, making it look as though it had cracked open...
PC Japanese (JP): 見て驚く。彼の額が割れたかのように、血が一筋、尾を引いていた…。
Russian (RU): Увиденное удивило их. Его лоб пересекала кровавая нить, создавая такое впечатление, будто он треснул...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que os surpreendeu. Havia um único fio de sangue escorrendo em sua testa, dando a aparência de rachado...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了更叫人吃驚。他的額頭似乎破了一般，順著淌下一條長長的血痕…。

Russian (RU): {a:c:Отныне{n}ты станешь хозяйкой этого острова{n}и будешь ждать того дня, когда он приедет выполнить своё обещание}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Deste dia em diante,{n}você será a governante desta ilha,{n}aguardando o dia que ele virá para cumprir sua promessa.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:你從今天開始，將會成為這個島的主人，{n}等待著他履行約定回來的那一天。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:你从今天开始，将会成为这个岛的主人，{n}等待着他履行约定回来的那一天。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:D'ora in avanti, diventerai la padrona di quest'isola e aspetterai il giorno in cui lui verrà ad adempiere la sua promessa. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:From this day forward, you will do this in my place. {n}So, from this day forward, you will no longer be me.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:From this day forward, you will do this in my place.{n}So, from this day forward, you will no longer be me.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:あなたは今日より、それを私より引き継ぐのです。{n}だから、今日より、あなたは私ではなくなります。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Отныне ты будешь ждать вместо меня.{n}Поэтому теперь ты больше не я}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Deste dia em diante, você fará isso em meu lugar.{n}Por isso, deste dia em diante, você não será mais eu.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:你從今天開始，將從我這裡繼承這一切。{n}所以，從今天開始，你就不再是我了。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:你从今天开始，将从我这里继承这一切。{n}所以，从今天开始，你就不再是我了。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:D'ora in avanti, tu farai ciò al mio posto. Perciò, d'ora in avanti, tu non sarai più me. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:Please forgive me for pushing all of my worries onto you, ...while I alone try to find happiness.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:Please forgive me for pushing all of my troubles onto you,{n}...while I alone try to find happiness.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:Please forgive me for pushing all of my worries onto you, ...while I alone try to find happiness.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:あなたに、私の苦悩を全て押し付けて、{n}……私だけ幸せになろうとすることを、許して下さい。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Прости, что перекладываю на тебя все свои заботы{n}......и одна стремлюсь обрести счастье}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Por favor, me perdoe por jogar todos os meus problemas em você,{n}...enquanto tento encontrar a felicidade só.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:請原諒我，將我的苦惱全都推給你，{n}……獨自去追求幸福。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:请原谅我，将我的苦恼全都推给你，{n}……独自去追求幸福。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:Ti prego, perdonami per aver spinto su di te tutte le mie sofferenze... mentre, da sola, cerco di trovare la felicità. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:From this day forward, you have the right to hate everything. {n}From this day forward, you are the Golden Witch, {f:5:Beatrice}.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:From this day forward, you have the right to hate everything.{n}From this day forward, you are the Golden Witch, {f:5:Beatrice}.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:From this day forward, you have the right to hate everything.{n}From this day forward, you are the Golden Witch, Beatrice.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:あなたは今日より、全てを憎む資格があります。{n}あなたは今日より、黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェ。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Отныне ты имеешь право ненавидеть всё.{n}Отныне ты — Золотая ведьма {f:5:Беатриче}}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Deste dia em diante, você tem o direito de odiar tudo.{n}Deste dia em diante, você é a Bruxa Dourada {f:5:Beatrice}.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:你從今天開始，擁有憎恨一切的資格。{n}你從今天開始，就是黃金的魔女，貝阿朵莉切。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:你从今天开始，拥有憎恨一切的资格。{n}你从今天开始，就是黄金的魔女，贝阿朵莉切。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:D'ora in avanti, avrai il diritto di detestare tutto. D'ora in avanti, sarai la Strega Dorata, Beatrice. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:And, one day... {n}You will destroy everything, revive everything. {n}...You will bring blessings to all lovers.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:And, one day,{n}you will destroy everything, revive everything,{n}......and bring blessings to all lovers.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:And, one day...{n}You will destroy everything, revive everything.{n}......You will bring blessings to all lovers.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:そしていつか。{n}全てを滅ぼして、全てを蘇らせて。{n}……全ての恋人たちに祝福を。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:И однажды...{n}Ты разрушишь всё, возродишь всё.{n}......Ты принесёшь счастье всем влюблённым}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:E, um dia,{n}você destruirá tudo, reviverá tudo,{n}......trará bênçãos a todos os amantes.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:然後總有那麼一天。{n}毀滅一切，又令一切復甦。{n}……賜予所有的戀人以祝福。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:然后总有那么一天。{n}毁灭一切，又令一切复苏。{n}……赐予所有的恋人以祝福。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:E un giorno... distruggerai tutto, resusciterai tutto. ... darai benedizioni a tutti gli amanti. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:When that happens... {n}...I pray that you and I...will both succeed in finding happiness.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:When that day comes,{n}......I pray that you and I will both have found happiness.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:When that happens...{n}......I pray that you and I......will both succeed in finding happiness.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:その時。{n}……私もあなたも、ともに幸せになれていることを、{n}……心より願っています。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Когда это случится...{n}......Надеюсь, что и ты, и я...... сумеем обрести счастье}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Quando esse dia chegar,{n}......eu rezo para que você e eu possamos encontrar a felicidade.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:那個時候。{n}……我和你，都能夠得到幸福，{n}……我從心底裏這麼希望。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:那个时候。{n}……我和你，都能够得到幸福，{n}……我从心底里这么希望。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:Quando ciò accadrà... Prego che io e te... riusciremo entrambe a trovare la felicità. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:From this day forward, you will no longer be me. {n}From this day forward, I will no longer be you. {n}The two of us will split apart a single soul and share it. {n}And though, of course, neither of us will possess a complete soul... {n}I'm sure our dreams will be more numerous than those of humans.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:From this day forward, you will no longer be me.{n}From this day forward, I will no longer be you.{n}The two of us will split a single soul and share it.{n}And though, of course, that won't amount to a complete soul...{n}I'm sure our dreams will be more numerous than most.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:From this day forward, you will no longer be me.{n}From this day forward, I will no longer be you.{n}The two of us will split apart a single soul and share it.{n}And though, of course, neither of us will possess a complete soul...{n}I'm sure our dreams will be more numerous than those of humans.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:あなたは今日より、私ではなくなります。{n}私は今日より、あなたではなくなります。{n}私たちは一つの魂を割いて、分け合おう。{n}それは一つの魂には当然満たないけれど。{n}きっと人より多くの夢を見させてくれる。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Отныне ты больше не будешь мной.{n}Отныне я больше не буду тобой.{n}Мы вдвоём расколем одну душу и разделим её.{n}И даже если ни у тебя, ни у меня не будет полной души...{n}Наши мечты непременно будут многочисленнее, чем у людей}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Deste dia em diante, você não será mais eu.{n}Deste dia em diante, eu não serei mais você.{n}Iremos dividir uma única alma e compartilhá‐la.{n}Embora, é claro, não seja o suficiente para uma alma completa...{n}Eu tenho certeza que nossos sonhos serão mais numerosos que todos os humanos.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:你從今天開始，不再是我。{n}我從今天開始，不再是你。{n}我們將一個靈魂分成兩半，各自分開。{n}那當然不滿一個完整的靈魂。{n}但是一定能讓我們有比別人更多的夢。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:你从今天开始，不再是我。{n}我从今天开始，不再是你。{n}我们将一个灵魂分成两半，各自分开。{n}那当然不满一个完整的灵魂。{n}但是一定能让我们有比别人更多的梦。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:D'ora in avanti, tu non sarai più me. D'ora in avanti, io non sarò più te. Noi due divideremo una singola anima e la condivideremo. E, ovviamente, sebbene nessuna di noi possiederà un'anima completa... sono sicura che i nostri sogni saranno più numerosi di quelli degli umani. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:Let us be blessed... {n}My dear...{f:5:Beatrice}...}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:Let us be blessed.........{n}My darling...{f:5:Beatrice}.........}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:Let us be blessed......{n}My dear...Beatrice...}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:私たちに、祝福あれ………。{n}私の可愛い、ベアトリーチェ………。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Пусть мы будем счастливы......{n}Моя дорогая... {f:5:Беатриче}}...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:A benção cairá sobre nós.........{n}Minha querida...{f:5:Beatrice}.........}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:請神祝福我們吧………。{n}我可愛的，貝阿朵莉切………。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:请神祝福我们吧………。{n}我可爱的，贝阿朵莉切………。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:Possiamo noi essere benedette... mia cara... Beatrice... }

Steam (ST): {a:c:No one will be able to see your form. {n}However, I alone can see you. {n}And if you are loved by many people... {n}I'm sure that everyone will be able to see you someday.}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:No one else can see your form.{n}But I can.{n}And if you're loved by a lot of people,{n}I'm sure they'll all start seeing you too.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:No one will be able to see your form.{n}However, I alone can see you.{n}And if you are loved by many people...{n}I'm sure that everyone will be able to see you someday.}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:誰にもあなたの姿は見えないけれど。{n}でも私にだけはあなたが見えるよ。{n}そしてあなたも色々な人に愛されれば。{n}きっとみんなにも姿が見えるようになっていく。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:Никто не сможет увидеть тебя.{n}Только я могу.{n}И если тебя полюбит много людей...{n}Однажды все они обязательно тебя увидят}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Ninguém mais pode ver sua forma.{n}Mas eu posso.{n}E se você for amada por muitas pessoas,{n}eu tenho certeza que todos passaram a vê‐la também.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:雖然誰都看不到你。{n}但只有我一定看得到你哦。{n}而且如果各種各樣的人都愛上你了的話。{n}大家一定都會看得到你。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:虽然谁都看不到你。{n}但只有我一定看得到你哦。{n}而且如果各种各样的人都爱上你了的话。{n}大家一定都会看得到你。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:Nessuno sarà capace di scorgere la tua sagoma. Tuttavia, io, da sola, posso vederti. E se sarai amata da molte persone... sicuramente, un giorno, chiunque ti potrà vedere. }

Steam (ST): {a:c:With love, they will be able to "see" us...}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:We can all {y:1:‘see’}{n:1:see}...if we have love......}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:With love, they will be able to see us......}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:愛があれば、私たちは視えるよ……。}
Russian (RU): {a:c:С любовью нас смогут увидеть......}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:Todos nós poderemos {y:1:‘ver’}{n:1:ver}...se tivermos amor......}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:只要有愛，我們就看得見哦……。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:只要有爱，我们就看得见哦……。}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c:Con l'amore, riusciranno a vederci... }

Steam (ST): Genji, who had been calm and silent through the whole thing, finally spoke.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji, who had been calm and silent through the whole thing, finally spoke.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 終始冷静で、一言も発しなかった源次が、ようやく口にした言葉が、それだった。
Russian (RU): Наконец‐то заговорил Генджи — спокойный и тихий несмотря на произошедшее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji, que se manteve calmo e em silêncio o todo todo, finalmente se pronunciou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 始終保持冷靜一言不發的源次，好不容易開口說的話，是這句。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 始终保持冷静一言不发的源次，好不容易开口说的话，是这句。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji, che era rimasto calmo e silenzioso in quella situazione, finalmente parlò.

Steam (ST): And, ...his were the most reasonable words spoken.
Umineko Project (UP): And those......were the most reasonable words spoken.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And, ......those were the most reasonable words spoken.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてそれが、……一番、的確な言葉だった。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且這是，……非常正確的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且这是，……非常正确的话。

Steam (ST): ...If they called Nanjo here, ...then what...?
Umineko Project (UP): ......If he called Nanjo here, ............then what...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......If they called Nanjo here, ......then what...?
PC Japanese (JP): ……南條を呼んで来たところで、…………どうしろと……？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……南條を呼んで来たところで、…………どうしろと……？
Russian (RU): ......Если они позовут сюда Нанджо...... что тогда?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se ele chamasse Nanjo aqui, ............então o quê...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……把南條叫來，…………又能怎麼樣……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……把南条叫来，…………又能怎么样……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Se avessero chiamato il dottor Nanjo... cos'avrebbe fatto...?

Steam (ST): Not only was there no arm to take the pulse of, ...there wasn't even a forehead to feel the heat of.
Umineko Project (UP): Not only was there no arm to take the pulse of, .........there wasn't even a forehead to feel the heat of.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Not only was there no arm to take the pulse of.........there wasn't even a forehead to feel the heat of.
PC Japanese (JP): 脈を取る腕どころか、………熱を測る額さえ。
Russian (RU): Не было ни руки, чтобы измерить пульс......... ни лба, чтобы проверить жар.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além de não haver braço para ver a pulsação, .........não havia testa para sentir o calor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 別說用來把脈的手腕，………就連用來測體溫的額頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 别说用来把脉的手腕，………就连用来测体温的额头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non solo non c'era un braccio di cui prendere il polso... non c'era nemmeno una fronte di cui sentire il calore.

Steam (ST): ...Like leftover snow on a spring day, ...Kanon's form had been...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Like the last unmelted snow greeting the warm sun of spring, ...Kanon's form...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Like the leftover snow on a summer day, ...Kanon's form was...
PC Japanese (JP): ………嘉音の姿は、……まるで、春の日を迎えた、残雪のように。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ………嘉音の姿は、……まるで、春の日を迎えた、残雪のように。
Russian (RU): ......Как остатки снега в летний день, ...Канон...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Assim como os resquícios de nuvem que cumprimentam o caloroso sol da primavera, ...foi a forma de Kanon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………嘉音的身體，……就像，春天到來之時的殘雪。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………嘉音的身体，……就像，春天到来之时的残雪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Come la neve rimasta in un giorno d'estate... la sagoma di Kanon era...

Steam (ST): ...By now, ...not even a trace remained.
Umineko Project (UP): ......There was no longer.........even a trace.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......By now, ......not even a trace remained.
PC Japanese (JP): ……もう、跡形さえ、………何も。
Russian (RU): ......К этому времени......... не осталось и следа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não restara mais.........um único vestígio.

Umineko Project (UP): His form......had sparkled with a spray of gold......and vanished completely......
